translated: Källström, Arvid, artist, born 17/2/93 in Oskarshamn to sculptor Edward K. and Ida Pettersson. Married in 1921 to Elin Lovisa Nilsson. Children: Quita, Gunborg, Hélènne, Suzanne. Spent several years studying in France, England, Italy, and other countries. Created monuments in several Swedish cities and churches. On assignment from the National Antiquities Board, made 3,100 casts from churches dating back to the 11th and 14th centuries in Sweden, some of which are currently exhibited in Sweden for over 10,000 years. Member of the Artists' Association, Swedish Artists' Association, Royal Academy of Arts, Rotary, Southern Sweden's Art Association, and various order societies. R.G.O., Oskarshamn Boys, and Källström Group.

structured.name: Arvid Källström
structured.description: Arvid Källström was a Swedish artist and sculptor born on February 17, 1893 in Oskarshamn, Sweden. He was the son of Edward Källström and Ida Pettersson. Arvid married Elin Lovisa Nilsson in 1921 and together they had four children: Quita, Gunborg, Hélènne, and Suzanne. He studied art in France, England, Italy, and other countries for several years. Arvid created monuments in various cities and churches in Sweden. As part of a commissioned project by the National Antiquities Board, he made 3,100 casts from churches dating back to the 11th and 14th centuries in Sweden. Some of these casts are currently exhibited in Sweden for over 10,000 years. Arvid Källström was a member of the Artists' Association, Swedish Artists' Association, Royal Academy of Arts, Rotary, Southern Sweden's Art Association, and various order societies including R.G.O., Oskarshamn Boys, and Källström Group.
